title: I just completed class 10th CBSE board exams. Can I apply for an IB school? - Quora
tags: Central Board of Secondary Education, India Advice
Central Board of Secondary Education, India

response.answer_text: I see no reason why you can’t apply for an IB school. It will be a new experience for you and combined with CBSE, it should make you an all rounder in academics and outside. You might find the program tough initially, because of two main reasons; tougher English and importance to extra-curricular activities. In CBSE, English is usually neglected a bit, while the sciences and math are prioritized, while the IB is not so. It gives equal status to all subjects and also has English literature, which is not taught. There will be a significant change in the teaching and learning styles as well. IBDP encourages self-learning and research, while CBSE (as far as I know) has fixed books to learn from. In IB, the student is trained for university by writing essays, sports activities, community service and others. The IB program focuses on the overall development of a student, and has proved to be a rich course, which makes the student ready for university and the world at large. If you decide to take the course, it will be a very enjoyable and exciting experience for you, along with your overall development. Cheers, and good luck!

Yes, you can definitely join an IB school. Although you will experience some change in the way of learning, most schools will accept CBSE students for the Diploma Program. If you have any specific questions, feel free to send me a message.
